titles: The seamans sorowful bride. See here the constant mournful bride, in sorrow doth complain; for fear her joy and hearts deligh [sic], should ne'r return again. To the tune of, Ah! Jenny Gin.
publisher: Printed for J. Deacon, in Guiltspur-street.,
notes: Verse: "My love is on the brackish sea ..."
Place and date of publication from Wing.
Reproduction of originals in the Harvard University, Houghton Library and the British Library.
